pullRequest.title: http dispatcher: use stream map as source of truth
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description: Removes most state management from the Http::Dispatcher and updates it with patterns better aligned to Envoy's own HTTP codecs. Existence in the stream map becomes the sole source of truth about whether a stream is open and may continue sending or receiving content.
Risk: Moderate
Testing: Local and CI
Signed-off-by: Mike Schore mike.schore@gmail.com

nodes.bodyText: I would somehow move this call back out to the calling function (either via return code or something else) so that all of the reset/closure logic is in one place.
I would probably inline this where it's called. I don't think it's worth moving out, for the same reason I commented on above (all closure logic in one place).

nodes.bodyText: What was the failure here? Shouldn't the race two ordering possibilities between local and remote reset still be covered?
looks like in the 200 case we are firing onComplete() in mapLocalResponseToError and then onRese() here?
I wonder if we should move stats charging to closeStream so that it is only done there, and we don't have a chance of double counting?
drop a comment that this is the expectation in higher layers, like the h2 codec does?
this is out of place now?
